channel.title: Arima on Factions and Figures
channel.description: Recent content in Arima on Factions and Figures

item.title: ARIMA and TBATS
item.description: And the forecasting begins ARIMA We can build ARIMA using the auto.arima function from the forecast package fit.arima <- auto.arima(y) print(fit.arima) ## Series: y ## ARIMA(1,1,1)(0,1,0)[12] ## ## Coefficients: ## ar1 ma1 ## 0.3698 -0.8957 ## s.e. 0.1780 0.1001 ## ## sigma^2 estimated as 8754: log likelihood=-279.46 ## AIC=564.92 AICc=565.48 BIC=570.47 # We produce the forecast in a similar way f.arima <- forecast(fit.arima,h=12) plot(f.arima) lines(y.test,col="red") TBATS (stands for somethingâ€¦) Similar to ETS, TBATS also offers a decomposition of the series Works with hourly and daily data!
